item.title: Emotional contagion
item.description:
Sometimes we Germans have nice descriptive words for things. One of these words is “Mitgef체hl” – compassion. However, if you split it into it’s constituent words and translate them, you’ll end up with “with feeling” – “with” as in togetherness.

In a sense, from the words that make up “Mitgef체hl”, it’s much closer to empathy, even if we Germans do not use it that way.

Generally, being compassionate and empathic are considered good traits.
